channel.title: Need help with commands :)

item.title: Need help with commands :)
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
@supermimez wrote:

try this, (you can get rid of the message)

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("home") && c.playerRights >= 0) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2526,4776,0); c.sendMessage("@dbl@You have teleported home"); }

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with commands :)
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:6, topic:537878”][quote author=Docent link=topic=656700.msg4394021#msg4394021 date=1388533683]
This doesn’t even make sense… its not working because all you are doing when you run the command is set variables equal to an integer, the teleporting method isn’t even there….
[/quote]Probably the absX, and absY are equaled to teleportToX, and teleportToY in his process() method hehehe
im pretty sure thats how its handled and why it works, cause using that will work in czar…[/quote]

Well, (@imperialdominance) add a method that teleports the player.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with commands :)
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Can you even do startswith and then ignore the case? LOL?
I’m just wondering but you’d be also missing semicolons…

I’ve kinda modified your code, so it should work.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { teleportToX = 3105; teleportToY = 3933; }

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with commands :)
item.dc:creator: @Pandora7 Pandora7
item.description:
@Pandora7 wrote:

Complex home command will be This

[code]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“home”)) {
int a = Misc.random(3);// # = how many teleports you want + bad variable naming, change it
switch(a) {
case 0:
c.getPA().startTeleport(2956, 3212, 0, “modern”);
break;

		default:
		c.getPA().startTeleport(2953, 3208, 0, "modern");
		case 1:
		c.getPA().startTeleport(2960, 3210, 0, "modern");
		break;
		}
		}[/code]

If your is a Pi base.

Read full topic

item.description:
@chaosplaya09 wrote:

are you using [PI] the cleaned version? if so, there wil be a // by the command teles, delete the // and you will be good to go.

item.title: Need help with commands :)
item.dc:creator: @imperialdominance imperialdominance
item.description:
@imperialdominance wrote:

:palm: Hello, I need help with commands in my 317 rsps, i’ve added this to the command section in my rsps, compiled it, but it still doesn’t work?

if (command.startsWith.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) { teleportToX = 3105 teleportToY = 3933 }

what should i do?

Read full topic
